name: humour
content:
humour noun
(AMUSEMENT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
B1 [ U ] the ability to find things funny, the way in which people see that some things are funny, or the quality of being funny: sense of humour He's got a great sense of humour (= he is very able to see things as funny).schoolboy humour I must say I find his schoolboy (= childish) humour rather tiresome.
More examplesFewer examplesThen there were his cringe-making attempts at humour.Even a speech on a serious subject should be leavened with a little humour.She has a mischievous sense of humour.His writing is spiked with humour.Do you like his brand of humour?

humour noun
(MOOD)
C2 [ C or U ] formal the state of your feelings: in a good/bad humour You seem in a very good humour today. Synonym
mood

to do what someone wants so that they do not become annoyed or upset: I applied for the job just to humour my parents.
